Date: January 10, 2025

Re: Patient - Robert Martinez
MRN: MRN-789456

Dear Colleague,

I am writing to provide a detailed report on the recent procedure performed on our mutual patient, Mr. Robert Martinez. 

Mr. Martinez, a 68-year-old male with a history of peripheral artery disease (PAD), diabetes type 2, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and coronary artery disease (CAD), underwent an Endovascular PAD Angioplasty on January 10, 2025. The procedure was performed by Dr. Sarah Chen in Operating Room OR-C3 using a Mobile C-arm Siemens Cios Alpha. 

The procedure was planned due to severe stenosis in the right superficial femoral artery (SFA) mid-segment, with an 85% occlusion, as revealed by a CT angiography performed on January 5, 2025. The planned intervention was a balloon angioplasty with provisional stenting, accessed via the right common femoral artery. 

Intraoperatively, Mr. Martinez remained stable with a blood pressure of 142/88 mmHg, heart rate of 78 bpm, and oxygen saturation of 98%. A total of 45 ml of contrast was used, well below the maximum limit of 75 ml. The fluoroscopy time was 12.5 minutes with a total radiation dose of 245 mGy.

Postoperatively, Mr. Martinez has been stable and recovering as expected. There were no complications during the procedure and his vital signs remained within normal limits.

For follow-up care, I recommend regular monitoring of Mr. Martinez's PAD symptoms and a repeat angiogram in 6 months to assess the patency of the treated vessel. He should continue his current medications including clopidogrel, aspirin, atorvastatin, and metformin. Given his allergy to iodine contrast, alternative contrast agents should be considered for future imaging studies.

Thank you for your continued collaboration in the care of Mr. Martinez. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or require additional information.
